Generation I.Red: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pok é mon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pok é mon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
Generation I.Yellow: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape as it appears to be made of a gas.
Generation I.Stadium: Made of a thin, gas-like substance that induces fainting if you get enshrouded in it. Will not appear if it is very windy.

Generation II.Gold: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
Generation II.Silver: Its thin body is made of gas. It can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
Generation II.Crystal: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.
Generation II.Stadium 2: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its thin body is made of gas. It can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pok é mon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
Generation III.Sapphire: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pok é mon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
Generation III.Emerald: When exposed to a strong wind, a Gastly 's gaseous body quickly dwindles away. They cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
Generation III.FireRed: A being that exists as a thin gas. It can topple an Indian elephant by enveloping the prey in two seconds.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pok é mon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

Generation IV.Diamond: This Pokémon's body is 95% made up of gases, which are blown away by strong gusts of wind.
Generation IV.Pearl: A Pokémon born from poison gases. It defeats even the largest foes by enveloping them in gas.
Generation IV.Platinum: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
Generation IV.HeartGold: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.

Generation V.Black: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
Generation V.White: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
Generation V.Black 2: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
Generation V.White 2: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

Generation VI.X: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
Generation VI.Y: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.

Generation VII.Sun: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
Generation VII.Moon: Although Gastly is barely visible, when it's near, a faint sweet smell lingers.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It's said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokémon.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Poisonous gas comprises 95% of its body. It's said that the remaining 5% is made up of the souls of those who died from the gas.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape, as it appears to be made of a gas.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape, as it appears to be made of a gas.

Generation VIII.Sword: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
Generation VIII.Shield: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: This Pokémon's body is 95 percent made up of gases. The Pokémon can be blown away by strong gusts of wind.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It's a Pokémon born from poison gases. It defeats even the largest foes by enveloping them in gas.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous—inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to faint instantly.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.
Generation IX.Violet: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
